entry.title: Pashinyan says CSTO a threat to Armenia‚Äôs future existence

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan says CSTO a threat to Armenia‚Äôs future existence
media:group.media:description:
üìç Pashinyan warns relations with the CSTO military alliance could reach a point of no return without answers on its responsibilities in Armenia. üìç Turkey reiterates its support for a corridor to connect parts of Azerbaijan through Armenia‚Äôs Syunik region, while Russia assures Iran it is supportive of its concerns about the opening of such a corridor. üìç Armenia‚Äôs authorities report they have arrested three people and issued arrest warrants for four more individuals accused of plotting an armed coup in Armenia. üìç The Legal Case For Genocide In Karabakh, interview with Luis Moreno Ocampo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hHJ9OEsOdz8 üìç Pursuing Justice for Armenian Victims, interview with Judge Gassia Apkarian: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8cZJn51RX7s
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Yerevan and Tbilisi work on advancing strategic partnership agreement

media:group.media:title: Yerevan and Tbilisi work on advancing strategic partnership agreement
media:group.media:description:
üìç U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken spoke by phone with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev to reiterate his support for a normalization deal with Armenia. üìç Prime Ministers Nikol Pashinyan of Armenia and Irakli Kobakhidze of Georgia held talks to build on their countries‚Äô strategic partnership agreement. üìç An Armenian court ordered a new trial for former President Robert Kocharyan in connection with post-election violence in 2008. Kocharyan was cleared three years ago on a previous charge also stemming from that incident. üìç Garo Paylan on Armenia-Turkey's Future: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N0FkEniXtE8 üìç ‚ÄòSky‚Äôs the limit‚Äô on Armenia‚Äôs wine renaissance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PTpUC6GrT-c

entry.title: ‚ÄòRussia and the Middle East in a Changing Geopolitical Environment‚Äô by Hanna Notte

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòRussia and the Middle East in a Changing Geopolitical Environment‚Äô by Hanna Notte
media:group.media:description:
Hanna Notte, an expert on Russian foreign and security policy, gave a lecture on ‚ÄúRussia and the Middle East in a Changing Geopolitical Environment‚Äù at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The lecture took place on July 2 in Yerevan.
Hanna Notte is a Senior Research Associate at the Vienna Center for Disarmament and Non-Proliferation and a Senior Associate (non-resident) in the Europe, Russia, and Eurasia Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies in Washington, D.C.
This year‚Äôs Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

media:group.media:title: Armenia's seismic vulnerabilities
media:group.media:description:
Civil engineer and Los Angeles city consultant Shahen Akelyan provides crucial insights into Armenia's seismic vulnerabilities and the urgent need for improved earthquake preparedness. Drawing from his expertise and experiences in Los Angeles and Japan, Akelyan outlines practical solutions and strategies that Armenia can implement to enhance its earthquake-resistant infrastructure. He offers both scientific knowledge and practical advice, serving as a wake-up call for policymakers and citizens to prioritize seismic safety measures in Armenia's urban development and construction practices.

entry.title: France ‚Äòalways by your side,‚Äô says top diplomat on first trip to Armenia

media:group.media:title: France ‚Äòalways by your side,‚Äô says top diplomat on first trip to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç France‚Äôs top diplomat pledged continued support for Armenia and urged Azerbaijan to engage in normalization talks in good faith. üìç Bagrat Galstanyan, Armenia‚Äôs archbishop turned protest leader, visited parliament for meetings with members of the country‚Äôs two main opposition groups. üìç Russia‚Äôs deputy prime minister said his country acknowledges Armenia‚Äôs sovereignty in efforts to reopen regional transit routes, in an apparent attempt at damage control. üìç This Week in Business: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t51xQA9qCGw

media:group.media:title: Pursuing Justice for Armenian Victims
media:group.media:description:
In this interview, Judge Gassia Apkarian, a prominent figure in the Superior Court of Orange County and leader of the Armenian Center for Truth and Justice, delves into the complex legal challenges facing Armenia and Karabakh Armenians. She addresses the critical issue of prosecuting Azerbaijani war crimes, exploring the tension between pursuing justice and negotiating peace. Judge Apkarian also offers invaluable insights on advocating for the rights of displaced Armenians, particularly the right of return, in the face of political obstacles and government inaction.

entry.title: Global scholars discuss the role of microhistory in Armenian academia

media:group.media:title: Global scholars discuss the role of microhistory in Armenian academia
media:group.media:description:
‚ÄúFrom Menocchio to Manuzzi: Conversations on Microhistory and the Global‚Äù highlighted the significance of microhistory in Armenian scholarship. The special event, which took place as part of the Yerevan Dialogue 2024 at the Cafesjian Center for the Arts in Armenia, featuring insights from renowned historians like Sebouh David Aslanian, Giovanni Levi, Carlo Ginzburg and Sanjay Subrahmanyam. The conversation explored the potential of microhistory in uncovering broader narratives through intimate, detailed historical accounts. With new translations of key works into Western Armenian, this marks a milestone in making complex histories accessible to Armenian scholars and students.
